column2: In the previous two sections, we discussed two

column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: approaches from these two models. The main idea is to
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: learning model, we obtain a set of information frames.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: For the result we get from single model of finite state
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: machine, if an information frame exists, it means the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sentence is stored in the finite state network. We
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: therefore assign a score 1.0. The result should be no
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: worse than any information frame we get from
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: statistical learning model. Otherwise, it means this
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sentence is not stored in our finite state work, we can
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: ignore this result. In the end, we combine this
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: information frame with the frame set from statistical
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: learning model and rank them according to the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: confidence scores. Generally we can consider the one
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: with the highest confidence score as our parsing result.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The cooperative model takes all advantages of the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: three methods and combines them together. The
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: cooperative mechanism also suppresses the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: disadvantages of those methods. The series model of the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: finite state machine has the advantage of mapping
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: between word classes and contexts, though it sometimes
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: may lose some information, and it contains real
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: semantic knowledge. The statistical learning model can
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: produce a set of information frames based on the word
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: patterns and its noise can be removed by the result of
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the series model of the finite state machine. For the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: single finite state machine model, if it can parse
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sentence successfully, the result will always be the best
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: one. Therefore through the cooperation of the three
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: methods, it can either produce the exact result for
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sentences stored in the finite state network or return the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: most probable result through statistical machine
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: learning method if no sentence matching occurs. Also
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the noise is reduced by the other finite state machine
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: model. The cooperative model is robust and has the
